content.raw:
I was unable to reproduce this error both in my quantal chroot using drcsim-2.5.2.tar.gz or in our [jenkins drcsim 2.5](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/drcsim_2.5/job/drcsim-drcsim_2.5-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-vrc/5/consoleFull) using the drcsim_2.5 branch.

Please, have you modified the code in any form? Which version are you exactly compiling? What is your version of gcc? Can you copy the full log of compilation into a pastebin? All this can help to see what is exactly the problem.

Thanks.

look pretty much identical to my machine here, and I am unable to reproduce the issue either.  Somehow your linking step does not appear to be stripping unused symbols.  Try adding compile flag below in your `ros/atlas_msgs/CMakeLists.txt`:

        add_definitions("-ffunction-sections")

and see if that helps.

        This is free software; see the source for copying conditions.  There is NO
        warranty; not even for MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

content.raw:
Thanks. I will try your suggestion and see how it works.

By the way, a few minutes ago I tried installing now in a Ubuntu 12.04 system (64 bits, ROS Fuerte, gcc 4.6) and I got [the same error](http://pastebin.com/ETRdtcw8). While I did not modify the DRCSim source code, I had to add a library to a Gazebo CMakeLists.txt file to make it compile:

gazebo/src/gazebo/common/CMakeListst.txt : I Added pthread to the target_link_libraries to fix linking errors.

Other than that, I did not modify the code. Gazebo works fine, while I get the error mentioned above while trying to install DRCSim

Thanks for all your help
content.html:
Thanks. I will try your suggestion and see how it works.

By the way, a few minutes ago I tried installing now in a Ubuntu 12.04 system (64 bits, ROS Fuerte, gcc 4.6) and I got the same error. While I did not modify the DRCSim source code, I had to add a library to a Gazebo CMakeLists.txt file to make it compile:

gazebo/src/gazebo/common/CMakeListst.txt : I Added pthread to the target_link_libraries to fix linking errors.

Other than that, I did not modify the code. Gazebo works fine, while I get the error mentioned above while trying to install DRCSim

Thanks for all your help

content.raw: It should be something different in the toolchain setup. You suffer from the same problem on quantal and precise. Were they fresh installations? No tweaks to the toolchain prior to compile gazebo?
content.html: It should be something different in the toolchain setup. You suffer from the same problem on quantal and precise. Were they fresh installations? No tweaks to the toolchain prior to compile gazebo?

content.raw:
As far as I can remember I did not do any tweak other than the mentioned for Gazebo. Also, the system was just installed, so no previous old packages lying around.

Finally I've given up and installed using Synaptic rather than compiling from source (in a Ubuntu 12.04, 64 bits with ROSFuerte). That works fine, it seems. Thanks for all your help!
content.html:
As far as I can remember I did not do any tweak other than the mentioned for Gazebo. Also, the system was just installed, so no previous old packages lying around.

Finally I've given up and installed using Synaptic rather than compiling from source (in a Ubuntu 12.04, 64 bits with ROSFuerte). That works fine, it seems. Thanks for all your help!
